title: Volunteer | Engineering Alumni | University of Illinois at Chicago
contents: It all starts with a single spark          Skip to the content of this page ,  the main menu , the secondary menu , the site search form , the site home page .           Engineering Alumni     Search the site     Toggle Menu      Search                  Engineering Alumni      Engineering Alumni   Main Menu    News           Dean's List    RISE Magazine         Events           Upcoming Events         Get Involved           Join us on LinkedIn    Become a Mentor    Volunteer    Engineer your own involvement    Honor a Professor         Awards           2019 Alumni Award Honorees    2018 Alumni Award Honorees    2017 Alumni Award Honorees         Give    Contact     Eyebrow menu    College of Engineering    Engineering Career Center    UIC menu    UIC.edu    Campus Map       Search               View Menu           Breadcrumbs   Engineering Alumni    Get Involved    Volunteer        Volunteer  Time is one of the most profound gifts an engineering or computer science graduate can make to UIC.  The college offers multiple ways for alumni to volunteer time to help the school, including:   Serving on an Engineering Alumni Association committee  Judging student projects at the Senior Design Expo  Being a mentor for an undergraduate student  Speaking or informally presenting to a class  Working with one of our student organizations  Welcoming students on a “site visit” to your company’s offices  Listing an internship or job opportunity at your organization that would welcome applications from UIC engineering or computer science students       volunteer   If you would like to volunteer, please fill out the form below. We will get in touch with you to talk about bringing your idea to life.
